title: Vignette 2: Calculate Population-Weighted Average Proximity for Larger Areas
text: avg_proximity() function accepts several inputs. Required inputs: : POLYGON MULTIPOLYGON sf object. Proximity calculated sum inverse distances polygon centroid features interest. : sf object representing features interest. features may POLYGONS, LINESTRINGS, POINTS, combination geometry types. group: grouping variable defines level statistics calculated . polygons must nested within group. Optional inputs: tolerance: maximum search distance features interest. provided, features within tolerance distance considered proximity calculations. can specify units tolerance using, units = ‘x’, x common length measurement abbreviation (e.g., ‘mi’, ‘yd’, ‘m’, etc.). weights: numeric vector length indicates weight applied feature. pop_weights: numeric vector representing population living polygon. provided, population-weighted average returned. Omitting pop_weights return simple average. prepare data analysis, calculate new field, County, group tracts counties. Counties can identified first five characters GEOID field. example, consider NPL sites within 20 miles census tract centroid. also request function return population-weighted average county. Results returned new sf object aggregated group level. Average proximity stored column, “avg_prox”.
code: ga$County <- substr(ga$GEOID, 1, 5) gacnty <- avg_proximity(from = ga,                         to = npls,                         tolerance = 20,                         units = "mi",                         group = "County",                         pop_weights = ga$POP)

code: fires_sf <- fires_sf |> filter(Year == 2020) summary(fires_sf$Acres) #>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max.  #>   0.010   0.200   0.750   3.421   2.675 309.400 fires_sf <- fires_sf |>   filter(Acres >= 1) |>   mutate(Severity  = log(Acres))

code: x = sf::st_polygon(list(rbind(c(33.9, -84.1),                               c(33.9, -84.0),                               c(34.0, -84.0),                               c(34.0, -84.1),                               c(33.9, -84.1)))) y = sf::st_point(c(34.1, -84)) x = sf::st_sfc(x, crs=4326) y = sf::st_sfc(y, crs=4326) #transform y into Albers Equal Area Conic projection y = sf::st_transform(y, crs = 5070) result <- sync_projection(x, y) #> x does not have a projected CRS. #> Projecting x into (+proj=aea +lat_0=23 +lon_0=-96 +lat_1=29.5 +lat_2=45.5 +x_0=0 +y_0=0 +datum=NAD83 +units=m +no_defs). plot(result[[1]], ylim = c(6510000, 6550000), col = NA, border = 'red') plot(result[[2]], add = TRUE, col =  'blue')
